entry.name: notPropEqual
entry.title: notPropEqual()

argument.name: message
argument.desc: A short description of the assertion

entry.desc: A strict comparison of an object's own properties, checking for inequality.

longdesc.p: The notPropEqual assertion uses the strict inverted comparison operator (!==) to compare the actual and expected arguments as Objects regarding only their properties but not their constructors.
When they aren't equal, the assertion passes; otherwise, it fails. When it fails, both actual and expected values are displayed in the test result, in addition to a given message.
equal() can be used to test equality.
propEqual() can be used to test strict equality of an Object properties.

example.desc: Compare the values of two objects properties.
